background: An office company manufactures desks and drawers, each requiring different amounts of assembly and sanding time. The company has limited time for these processes.
constraints: Total assembly time for desks and drawers cannot exceed TotalAssembly minutes
Total sanding time for desks and drawers cannot exceed TotalSanding minutes
objective: Maximize the company's profit from manufacturing desks and drawers
description: An office company makes desks and drawers. Each desk requires \param{AssemblyDesk} minutes of assembly and \param{SandingDesk} minutes of sanding. Each drawer requires \param{AssemblyDrawer} minutes of assembly and \param{SandingDrawer} minutes of sanding. The company has \param{TotalAssembly} minutes for assembly and \param{TotalSanding} minutes for sanding. If the profit per desk is $\param{ProfitDesk} and the profit per drawer is $\param{ProfitDrawer}, how many of each should the company make to maximize profit?

parameters.definition: Minutes of assembly required for each desk
Minutes of sanding required for each desk
Minutes of assembly required for each drawer
Minutes of sanding required for each drawer
